page.title: 08BISHOP BURTON CLUBS & SPORTS
page.content: The Church runs a{Sunday School}of 20 children, a small{choir}of 8 people and a bell-ringing rota. The{Village Hall}(built in the 1950's and funded by the village) holds two {youth clubs}organised for the 5 - 16 year olds. Football is played on the village green. There was a Ladies Keep Fit class which has now been disbanded due to lack of enthusiasm. But those who are more energetic use the College sports facilities to play tennis, badminton and squash. The College also has table tennis and snooker facilities. There is a local cricket team with its own cricket ground on the village outskirts, but all the members come from outside the village. The College has rugby and cricket teams. The old age pensioners of the village run a{Darby and Joan Club,} helped by the Beverley Lions.
